definitions.definition: say something in order to convey information, an opinion, or a feeling.
examples: in his agitation he was unable to speak
synonyms: verbalize "she refused to speak about it"

examples: I wish to speak privately with you
synonyms: shoot the breeze; formalconfabulate "we spoke the other day"

examples: patients copy words spoken by the therapist

definitions.definition: communicate in or be able to communicate in (a specified language).
make a speech before an audience, or make a contribution to a debate.
examples: twenty thousand people attended to hear him speak
synonyms: sound off "the minister spoke for two hours"

definitions.definition: express the views or position of (another person or group).
examples: he claimed to speak for the majority of local people
synonyms: be spokesperson for More"she speaks for the Arts Council"advocate

definitions.definition: convey one's views or position indirectly.
examples: speaking through his attorney, he refused to join the debate

definitions.definition: mention or discuss in speech or writing.
synonyms: describe "he was spoken of as a promising student"

definitions.definition: (of behavior, a quality, an event, etc.) serve as evidence for something.
examples: her harping on him spoke strongly of a crush

definitions.definition: (of an object that typically makes a sound when it functions) make a characteristic sound.
show or manifest (someone or something) to be in a particular state or to possess a certain quality.
examples: she had seen nothing that spoke him of immoral habits

definitions.definition: (of an organ pipe or other musical instrument) make a sound.
examples: insufficient air circulates for the pipes to speak

definitions.definition: hail and hold communication with (a ship) at sea.
talk to in order to reprove or advise.
examples: she tried to speak to Seth about his drinking
synonyms: give someone what for; formalcastigate "you must speak to him about his rudeness"

definitions.definition: talk to in order to give or extract information.
examples: he had spoken to the police
the Church wants to speak to real issues
the story spoke to him directly
